Given the area of a trapezium, calculate a missing dimension

explanations.A: When finding the height of a trapezium, start by finding the two parallel sides: a and b. The perpendicular distance between these 2 sides is the height of the trapezium. In this case the parallel sides are 5cm and 1cm so the perpendicular height between these is 4cm.
explanations.B: This does look like the height but the trapezium has been rotated... The height is actually the perpendicular distance between the parallel sides a and b. Start by finding the parallel sides and see which length is the perpendicular distance between them.
explanations.C: The height of the trapezium has to be the perpendicular height between the parallel sides, you have given the slant height..
explanations.D: This is one of the parallel sides a and b. The height is the perpendicular distance between the parallel sides...

explanations.A: I think you have done 3 x 5. For the area of a trapezium we add the two parallel sides, divide by 2 and then multiply by the perpendicular height.
explanations.B: Almost, remember we have to divide by 2.
explanations.C: For this trapezium, a & b are 3cm and 7cm (as these are the parallel sides) and the height is 5cm. To find the area of the trapezium we do (a+b)/2 x height which equals (3+7)/2 x 5 = 5 x 5 = 25cm².
explanations.D: I think you have added 5 and 3. For the area of a trapezium we add the two parallel sides, divide by 2 and then multiply by the perpendicular height.
